abstract: Lawmakers tell Secretary of State Hillary Clinton that a consulting firm with close ties to TransCanada should not have been assigned to study a pipeline's potential impact.
snippet: Lawmakers tell Secretary of State Hillary Clinton that a consulting firm with close ties to TransCanada should not have been assigned to study a pipeline's potential impact.
lead_paragraph: With a decision expected by the end of the year from the Obama administration on the proposed Keystone XL pipeline, members of Congress have sent two letters to Secretary of State Hillary Clinton raising concerns over the State Department's handling of a critical environmental review of the project.

headline.main: 36 Lawmakers Berate State Dept. on Pipeline
